/getting-started/step-four/.title: Review your privacy settings
/getting-started/step-four/.content:
by default spacebook sites are set they will get indexed by google other search engines send referrer links outside cannot tracked analytics there ad trackers tracking cookies nonsense installed want open your site public eye < href="#makeyoursitesearchable!">jump down easy instructions how share with rest world

security through obscurity

by hidden from engines won’t truly secure anybody who discovers link able view site this similar anyone link permissions commonly docs can use obscured netlify url added protection against accidental discovery default setting safe many cases

password encryption

privacy priority wish put behind password following href="/encryption">password protection instructions encrypt all files require users enter password before viewing when enable option see small performance hit because each page being decrypted fly loads

basic authentication

upgrade account basic wide authentication necessary level two encryption less rough around edges does encryption slow once have authenticated cost $20 month thereabouts

making public

some point may general public simple matter removing changing robotstxt file links

remove href="http://robotsmd" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">robotsmd

engines simply remove rename < noreferrer">robotsmd file root project ( change _includes/layouts/robotsnjk template reflect robots liking!)

mditerator plugin settings eleventyjs configuration these external links reference “noreferrer” shown below:

eleventyjs eleventyconfigsetlibrary("md" markdownit(options) use(mditerator 'url_new_win' 'link_open' function (tokens idx) { const [attrname href] = tokens[idx]attrsfind(attr => attr[0] === 'href') (href && (!hrefincludes('franknoirotco') !hrefstartswith('/') !hrefstartswith('#'))) tokens[idx]attrpush([ 'target' '_blank' ]) 'rel' 'noopener' ])  noreferrer line! } })
should leave noopener place unless also call target _blank which case probably just whole plugin!

/advanced/.title: Advanced settings
/advanced/.content:
following sections outline some things can with your spacebook that take bit more work set never fear:

  • < href="/advanced/navigation/">navigation layout

/advanced/analytics/.title: Adding analytics
/advanced/analytics/.content:
have public spacebook sometimes can useful ( fun) get idea how many people are visiting this easy free paid) respects your user’s privacy almost zero impact site performance

cloudflare analytics (free)

cloudflare offers free privacyfirst lightweight relatively unknown service that allows basic data without having change dns records all requires simple js embed head page

  • < href="https://wwwcloudflarecom/webanalytics/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">sign cloudflare analytics
  • add provided script _includes/components/headnjk
_includes/components/headnjk<script defer="defer" src="https://staticcloudflareinsightscom/beaconminjs" datacfbeacon="{"token";: "yourtoken">

netlify analytics

netlify similar just awesome system starting $9/mo per domain already business plan)

  • < href="https://wwwnetlifycom/products/analytics/" noreferrer">netlify analytics
did know both these scripts extremely lightweight unlike google will essentially peformance!

/advanced/comments/.title: Adding comments
/advanced/comments/.content:
there are variety use cases where may wish enable commenting some all your spacebook pages there numerous free paid solutions set accommodate whichever comment engine makes most sense

choosing engine

there few ways go about this depending specific needs significant pros cons each option:

paid options

want sell soul subject users ads tracking scripts best option service that respects user privacy:

  • < href="https://fastcommentscom/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">fastcomments – price cup coffee tip ($5/month) can have robust privacy first friendly supports 1000000 page views across multiple domains per month used spacebookapp spacebooks need pages perfect solution

  • < href="https://commentoio/" noreferrer">commento similar more polished looking service costs $10/mo domain

free options

  • < href="https://utterances/" noreferrer">utterances very slick uses github issues show comments realtime downside requires (free) account currently does offer support private repos concern likely ( willing) authenticate via their account sweet option

  • < href="https://gitalkgithubio/" noreferrer">gitalk utterances with limitations

  • < href="https://disquscom/" noreferrer">disqus (free plan) fine widely don’t mind ads trackers bloated code will destroy performance scores going pay good commenting would fastcomments commento hundred times over before choosing disqus

  • < href="https://developersfacebookcom/docs/plugins/comments/" noreferrer">facebook comments blech

  • < href="https://wwwtaniarasciacom/addcommentsstaticsite/" noreferrer">roll own get ambitious roll own system using something like < href="https://jamstackcommentsnetlifyapp/" noreferrer">netlify/githubbased solution any other self host cheap cloud container

’ve chosen engine!

once engine easy site perpage basis just follow these simple steps:

enable _data/sitesjson

"enablecomments": true  true!
this block pagenjk template (see below)

paste into pagenjk

all solutions above rely paste anywhere comments case spacebook simply add _includes/layouts/pagenjk template here example fastcomments:

_includes/layouts/pagenjkwindowfastcommentsui(documentgetelementbyid('fastcommentswidget') {'});

disable needed

when comments by default see disable certain pages new line frontmatter page:

title: date: 20201120permalink: /example/indexhtmlcomments: 0 pageeleventynavigation: key: example order: 35
that’s company who first offers generous tier ad/trackingfree make fortune coming years

/getting-started/configure/.title: Configure your site
/getting-started/configure/.content:
once have your spacebook running first step some basic configuration make own all site stored single file located _data/sitejson

local copy installed can edit this directly commit using github ui default sitejson looks like :

{ "name": "spacebook" "subtitle": "create modern notebook document explain almost anything" "description": anything with spacebookapp"" "url": "https://spacebookapp" "githuburl": "https://githubcom/broeker/spacebook" "githubbranch": "main" "navigationstyle": "horizontal" "emoji": "" "enablesearch": true "enabledarkmode": "enableeditbutton": "enabledatestamp": "enablegithublink": "enablecontact": false "enablenetlifycms": "enablecomments": "enableencryption": "enablepagenavigation": true}

basic settings

when changes deploy them will automically update reflect new settings:

  • name – name title appears header
  • subtitle (optional) short subtitle that directly below name
  • description used metadata page description overridden pagebypage basis needed
  • footer plain text bottom footer
  • githuburl address repository generate links
  • githubbranch main primary branch (set “main” by default)
  • navigationstyle set navigation horizontal (default) vertical prefer top bar
  • emoji emoji favicon
  • url url netlify (this currently seems wise track config)

enable disable features

  • enablesearch enable elasticlunr search engine
  • enablecontact contact form
  • enabledarkmode darkmode functionality
  • enableeditbutton “edit button”
  • enabledatestamp date stamp each page
  • enablegithublink link icon footer
  • enablenetlifycms cms (false default)
  • enableencryption logout button are encryption default)
  • enablepagenavigation built page
did know optional < href="/advanced/netlifycms/">netlify integration these settings also changed via cms

there probably few may wish change netlify:

  • something more personal under general > details name
  • leave form enabled notifications forms notifications
  • build & contexts
  • explore other settings!
now ’ve got configured wishes move next start working content

/getting-started/content/.title: Set up your content
/getting-started/content/.content:
all your pages images are stored toplevel directory called content with subfolder (content/pages) one (content/images) when first install spacebook will contain default welcome page that can change delete

did know trick managing spacebook basic understanding markdown how used create organize content use editor github ui examine any files folder get lay land

understanding frontmatter

frontmatter complicated sounding word simple concept frontmatter simply few lines configuration live top files this tells what behave minimal file between block three dashes like :

title: hello world date: 20201120permalink: /hello/indexhtmleleventynavigation: order: 10 key:
  • title – shows main h1 header
  • date (optional) last updated date appears each page standard format such 20210131 handy last modified value (which automatically update time save commit)
  • permalink permalink define url must follow format end indexhtml
  • eleventynavigation menu item page tell where appear hierarchy
    • order determines relative other items (0=first)
    • key “label” also serves slug key track parent child pages

frontmatter options

there four additional add affect behaves including ability hierarchy pages:

title: about us metadescription: override page's description metatag  /about/indexhtmlcomments: false eleventynavigation: parent: home  title: custom title
  • metadescription: pagebypage basis present global from sitesjson used
  • comments (opt out) have set enablecomments true configtoml comments all unless opt out using comments: false
  • parent system parent given match key another show within system
  • title label (useful want short longer label)
enable optional < href="/netlifycms">netlify cms integration these settings changed via cms

adding content

once understand frontmatter begin adding editing content markdown anything directly below body /about/indexhtmleleventynavigation: this content! your include sorts href="/tipstricks/markdown">markdown tags structure however makes most sense best consistent formatting techniques throughout keep them looking good

working locally should seeing changes work netlify soon site builds finishes its deploy

mind spaces indents

mind spaces! sure space after entry indent properly cause error build nested options under eleventynavigation indented exactly two spaces

/getting-started/deploy/.title: Deploy your changes
/getting-started/deploy/.content:
deploying changes your site could any easier:

  • are editing files directly github building each time save commit main branch depending amount pages usually takes 60 seconds less complete deploy
  • locally will automatically build every push accept pull request into github again around unless very large
  • using netlify cms builds click publish button
that’s !

did know can monitor deploys realtime via dashboard there also variety settings use things like preview branch deploys

/advanced/encryption/.title: Password protect your spacebook
/advanced/encryption/.content:
by default your spacebook set < href="/privacy">nondiscoverable can also protect entire site behind password when enable will encrypted by href="https://githubcom/robinmoisson/staticrypt" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">staticrypt all users need enter password decrypt view

demo site

demo: href="https://deploypreview10spacebookappnetlifyapp/tipstricks/ordering/" noreferrer">spacebook (password = spacebook)

did know netlify does allow basic authentication their free tier are already paid plan willing then better simply via dashboard instead using instructions below

set netlify

  • visit go site settings > build & deploy environment

  • click edit variables new variable with key password value choice unlocking site:

< href="/static/img/passwordpng" target="_self">

ever change this password prevented from accessing content until they have password

enable encryption

_data/configtoml file encryption true:

{ "enableencryption": true  true! }
this enable logout button that appears header whenever enabled

change command

now command netlifytoml file comment out current npm run build directly below like :

[build] publish "_site" line  #command "npm build" uncomment one && e find /_site type f name '*html' exec staticrypt f password_templatehtml {} $password o \\;"
that’s !

when pages time require access passphrase stored local storage remain logged future visits click () administrator changes password

want remove protection reverse process longer time

/.title: Getting started
/.content:
create your own spacebook exactly like this one customize needs spacebooks are speedy set free 100% open source

  • easy use – add new page appears magically navigation make edits right from phone
  • writing focused beautiful typography minimalist design managed with easyuse markdown
  • speedy accessible static files responsive system fonts minimal javascript purge minify all things accessible people devices
  • privacy first useragent: * disallow: / by default noreferrer links; encrypt full site password desired
  • flexible horizontal vertical disable features don’t need advanced serverless functions alpinejs
spacebooks modern notebooks can use create documentation sketch out ideas plan project whatever suits fancy

quick launch ‍

’re adventurous type now click button ’ll need existing < href="https://githubcom/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">github account href="https://wwwnetlifycom/" noreferrer">netlify account (which during process wish):

< href="https://appnetlifycom/start/deployrepository=https://githubcom/broeker/spacebook">
that button follow steps netlify robots will copy repository personal github account once complete automatically deployed cloud its url ready customization

did know host project anywhere currently assume noreferrer">netlify various may dependent (eg contact forms identity) they provide generous free tier pioneers breed web hosting makes simple push some files speedy global cdn serve faster than blink

what spacebook

website generator help just using bunch cool modern fast technology:

  • < href="https://www11tyio" noreferrer">eleventy super nodebased stays way lets ship only what want
  • < href="https://tailwindcsscom/" noreferrer">tailwind 20 brilliant tiny utilityfirst css framework
  • < href="https://githubcom/alpinejs/alpine" noreferrer">alpinejs javascript
  • < href="http://elasticlunrcom/" noreferrer">elasticlunr lightweight fulltext search engine
  • < href="https://githubcom/markdown/markdown" noreferrer">advanced markdown support footnotes custom containers emoji support tables task lists autolinked images
  • < cms (optional) easy markdown editor creating changing content
never fear! know understand any spacebook results easyuse typically scores 100s across board google lighthouse metrics mobile desktop

shoulders giants

features

almost optional toggled configuration file:

  • horizontal navigation
  • page navigation
  • keyword search
  • dark mode

  • contact form
  • netlify cms

who needs anybody who believes href="https://indieweborg/" noreferrer">#indieweb wants simple put notebooklike thing control:

  • writers thinkers
  • planners dreamers
  • technical doc writers
  • project managers
  • teachers students
anyone willing learn few things many they’d reason world

installing spacebook

theory without ever downloading code running locally green above edit directly github! ( ui fairly friendly entirely possible manage via phone ) codebase write local editor download install locally

requirements

must node version 12 higher due tailwind 20 release recommend nvm easily node versions switch back forth between older versions

  • < href="https://nodejsorg/" noreferrer">node
  • < href="https://githubcom/nvmsh/nvm" noreferrer">nvm (optional)
find current version:

node version

step one

already have automated install simply clone repository:

try locally directly:

git https://githubcom/broeker/spacebook
note: choose second option remove git folder upstream moving forward also href="https://githubcom/broeker/spacebook" noreferrer">fork repository github

install run initial build command:

cd spacebooknpm installnpm (only necessary first time!)
get errors here double check version

now spin server see site:

npm start
this command start able work hot reloads nice browsersync features locally connecting netlify later into repository then connected repository

/tips-and-tricks/images/.title: Working with images and all the great creatures large and small
/tips-and-tricks/images/.content:
can drop images diagrams illustrations anywhere your content images are automatically set 100% width centered with subtle shadow some small padding there two primary methods adding pages each its own pros cons:

standard images

have used markdown before this will familiar typical way images:

  • add image /content/images folder – any into /content/images folder able reference from pages
  • reference page once ’ve added using following syntax:
![space](/content/images/spacejpg)
< href="/content/images/spacejpg" target="_self">

file size

using technique page load exactly exported which means responsible file size dimensions upload 20mb file restricted main column width sending entire 20mb (this bad idea! )

other notes

  • each linked fullsized version that open new tab
  • this useful sharing large diagrams other may benefit full screen viewing
  • your explicit height produces warning ( performance hit) google lighthouse scores
did know sizing optimization should smallest image use editor number online tools compress before uploading!

also refer external via url including sized unsplashed transformed cloudinary source online:

/tips-and-tricks/links/.title: Working with links
/tips-and-tricks/links/.content:
working with links markdown simple once get hang

pasted links

simplest use case can paste link directly into your will transform active hyperlink:

https://enwikipediaorg/wiki/main_page
< href="https://enwikipediaorg/wiki/main_page" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://enwikipediaorg/wiki/main_page

internal links

create nicely formatted interal title this syntax:

[tips & tricks](/tipstricks)
< href="/tipstricks">tips tricks

internal should start slash include path that matches permalink set page are linking

external links

use same syntax external url title:

[wikipedia](https://enwikipediaorg/wiki/main_page)
< noreferrer">wikipedia

/advanced/netlifycms/.title: Enabling Netlify CMS
/advanced/netlifycms/.content:
< href="https://wwwnetlifycmsorg/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">netlify cms simple user interface that lets add edit preview your markdown files via browserbased editor very useful beginners anybody who wants easy managing content

enable netlify cms

edit site configuration _data/sitesjson set enablenetlifycms true

{ "enablenetlifycms": true  this true! }
once enabled will see small gear icon lower right corner can use access cms once configured ( don’t want icon keep false still work)

  • from dashboard enabled identity site settings > enable identity
  • once click identity services then enable git gateway

  • now go registration providers add provider
  • enable github / google (typically both)
  • this both yourself any collaborators login directly using existing accounts

set invite only

unless open ( advised) only preferences “edit settings” change only

login edit content

should now able into by clicking link footer visting < href="https://yoursitenetlifyapp/_admin_" noreferrer">https://yoursitenetlifyapp/_admin_

did know experience when confirm also show button again did just authenticate again cms sometimes little wonky place works fine

invite other users

/tips-and-tricks/ordering/.title: Understanding ordering
/tips-and-tricks/ordering/.content:
both primary menu page navigation rely order setting frontmatter each your pages

homepage

your homepage set order: 0 which will put top global navigation

title: homedate: 20201120permalink: /eleventynavigation: order: 0  this determines structure! key: home

other pages

have hierarchical structure are simply showing list toplevel pages ordering simple all pages appear order from lowest highest subpages displayed using scheme

hierarchical pages

with that includes parent child important note must follow strict throughout hierarchy example here typical structure:

title: homekey: homeorder: title: page onekey: oneorder: 10  title: subpage one parent: 20 two 30 twokey: twoorder: 40 threekey: threeorder: 50
this result correct provide proper navigation

ordering tips

did know wise leave some space between initial per example above help avoid having changing settings whenever want add new into existing structure!

remove navigation

eleventynavigation frontmatter available direct links menu
